original: gos ji lta bu zhig ce na de'i phyir ngan pa'o zhes bya ba smras te thams cad kyi tha ma'o//
analyzed: gos ji lta bu zhig ce na de'i phyir ngan pa'o zhes bya ba smras te thams cad kyi tha ma'o//

original: de bcos so zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: de bcos so zhes bya ba ni /
translated: That is to be repaired, means

original: sprug pa'i don du spyad pa'i gos ngan pa de'o //
analyzed: sprug pa'i don du spyad pa'i gos ngan pa de'o //
translated: that bad cloth used for shaking is to be repaired.

original: mi nus pa nyid na ras mar byas te shing bu'i rtse mo la btags nas sprug go zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: mi nus pa nyid na ras mar byas te shing bu'i rtse mo la btags nas sprug go zhes bya ba ni /
translated: If one is unable to do that, one should make a cloth bag, attach it to the end of a stick, and shake it, means

original: des khri la sogs pa dag sprug go zhes bya bar sbyar te /
analyzed: des khri la sogs pa dag sprug go zhes bya bar sbyar te /
translated: that one should shake the bed, etc., with that.

original: gos ngan pa de ha cang zhigs ches par gyur na gang gi tshe des khri la sogs pa dag sprug par mi nus shing phyir bcos su mi rung ba de'i tshe gos zhigs pa de ras mar byas ta dam dum du gshegs nas shing bu'i rtse mo la
analyzed: gos ngan pa de ha cang zhigs ches par gyur na gang gi tshe des khri la sogs pa dag sprug par mi nus shing phyir bcos su mi rung ba de'i tshe gos zhigs pa de ras mar byas ta dam dum du gshegs nas shing bu'i rtse mo la
translated: When that bad robe is very torn and it is not possible to beat the bed and so on with it, and it is not possible to repair it, then that torn robe should be made into a rag, cut into small pieces, and tied to the top of a stick.

original: btags te sbrang yab bzhin du des khri la sogs pa dag sprug par bya'o //
analyzed: btags te sbrang yab bzhin du des khri la sogs pa dag sprug par bya'o //
translated: Like a fly whisk, it should be used to beat the bed and so on.

original: de ltar yang mi rung ba nyid yin na sbyin pa po'i bsod nams mngon par spel ba dang yun ring ba nyid du bya ba'i byir lci ba dang sa dag bsres te ka ba dang rtsig pa'i ser ka glan par bya'o zhes bya ba ni //
analyzed: de ltar yang mi rung ba nyid yin na sbyin pa po'i bsod nams mngon par spel ba dang yun ring ba nyid du bya ba'i byir lci ba dang sa dag bsres te ka ba dang rtsig pa'i ser ka glan par bya'o zhes bya ba ni //
translated: If that is also not possible, then in order to increase the merit of the donor and to make it last a long time, the holes in the pillars and walls should be filled with a mixture of clay and cow dung.

original: de ltar ras mar byas kyang khri la sogs pa sprug par mi nus pa nyid yin na ji skad smos pa de bzhin bya ba'o //
analyzed: de ltar ras mar byas kyang khri la sogs pa sprug par mi nus pa nyid yin na ji skad smos pa de bzhin bya ba'o //
translated: If it is not possible to make it into a rag and beat the bed and so on as described, then it should be done as stated.

original: sgo gang dang khyams su mal bca' ba dang bcas na yang gzung bar mi bya'o zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: sgo gang dang khyams su mal bca' ba dang bcas na yang gzung bar mi bya'o zhes bya ba ni /

original: de dag tu mal bca' bar yang mi bya la gzhan gyis bcas na yang rang gis gzung bar mi bya'o //
analyzed: de dag tu mal bca' bar yang mi bya la gzhan gyis bcas na yang rang gis gzung bar mi bya'o //
translated: One should not set up a bed there, nor should one take possession of it if others have set it up.

original: sbyin pa po mya ngan bsang ba'i phyir phul ba des mthong bar gzhag par mi bya'o zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: sbyin pa po mya ngan bsang ba'i phyir phul ba des mthong bar gzhag par mi bya'o zhes bya ba ni /
translated: One should not set up a bed that a donor has offered to relieve his grief, so that the donor may see it.üîΩThis rule was formulated because King Prasenajit offered his mother's bed to the Sangha to relieve his grief at his mother's death.

original: @371b rgyal po gsal rgyal gyis rang gi ma shi ba'i mya ngan bsang ba'i phyir ma'i mal khri dge 'dun la phul ba dge slong dag gis sgo gang dang khyams su bshams pa rgyal pos mthong nas yang mya ngan langs pa byung ba'i mtha' las bcas pa yin
analyzed: @371b rgyal po gsal rgyal gyis rang gi ma shi ba'i mya ngan bsang ba'i phyir ma'i mal khri dge 'dun la phul ba dge slong dag gis sgo gang dang khyams su bshams pa rgyal pos mthong nas yang mya ngan langs pa byung ba'i mtha' las bcas pa yin
translated: The monks set it up in the gateway and courtyard, and when the king saw it, he was again overcome with grief.

original: te / de lta bu'i rdzas sbyin bdag gis mthong bar mi bya'o //
analyzed: te / de lta bu'i rdzas sbyin bdag gis mthong bar mi bya'o //
translated: One should not set up such an object in a place where the donor can see it.

original: sgra mi snyan pa'i gnyen po'i phyir tshes brgyad dang bcu bzhi dag la khyams su bsham par bya'o zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: sgra mi snyan pa'i gnyen po'i phyir tshes brgyad dang bcu bzhi dag la khyams su bsham par bya'o zhes bya ba ni /
translated: For the sake of the relatives of Kuru, one should set up the bed in the courtyard on the eighth and fourteenth days of the month.

original: sbyin bdag gis mthong bar mi bya ba'i phyir rdzas de sbas pa na /
analyzed: sbyin bdag gis mthong bar mi bya ba'i phyir rdzas de sbas pa na /
translated: When the object is hidden so that the donor cannot see it,

original: gal te gzhan dag 'di skad ces dge slong de dag gis mal khri de brkus so zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i sgra mi snyan pa skur pa dang phyar ka dang dri ngas su 'gyur ba de bsal ba'i phyir gnyen po'i phyir tshes brgyad dang bcu bzhi la
analyzed: gal te gzhan dag 'di skad ces dge slong de dag gis mal khri de brkus so zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i sgra mi snyan pa skur pa dang phyar ka dang dri ngas su 'gyur ba de bsal ba'i phyir gnyen po'i phyir tshes brgyad dang bcu bzhi la
translated: If others say, ‚ÄúThose monks stole that bed,‚Äù and so on, in order to dispel such unpleasant accusations, slander, and criticism, on the eighth and fourteenth days of the month,

original: sogs pa dus dus su sbyin bdag de med pa'i skabs su mal khri la sogs pa de dag khyams la sogs pa dag tu bshams shing gzhan gyis mthong bar bya'o //
analyzed: sogs pa dus dus su sbyin bdag de med pa'i skabs su mal khri la sogs pa de dag khyams la sogs pa dag tu bshams shing gzhan gyis mthong bar bya'o //
translated: when the donor is not present, they should set out the beds and so on in the courtyard and other places, so that others can see them.

original: khri dang khri'u bcang bar bya ba'o zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: khri dang khri'u bcang bar bya ba'o zhes bya ba ni /
translated: ‚ÄúOne should use a bed and a bench.‚Äù

original: gang zag gis kyang ngo //üîΩspyil ba mi nyams par bya ba'i phyir khri rkang gi mthil mnyam par bcas par bya'o zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: gang zag gis kyang ngo // spyil ba mi nyams par bya ba'i phyir khri rkang gi mthil mnyam par bcas par bya'o zhes bya ba ni /
translated: This refers to individuals.üîΩ‚ÄúThe base of the bed legs should be fitted with supports in order to prevent damage to the huts.‚Äù

analyzed: sa gzhi spyil ba 'jam po mi nyams par bya ba'i phyir ro //

original: yang na de'i 'og tu phub ma'i phung po bzhag pa'am de ras mas dkri bar bya'o zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: yang na de'i 'og tu phub ma'i phung po bzhag pa'am de ras mas dkri bar bya'o zhes bya ba ni /
translated: Or else, a pile of straw should be placed under it, or it should be wrapped in cloth.

translated: In order to prevent the hut from being destroyed, either a pile of straw should be placed under the leg of the bed, or the leg of the bed should be wrapped in cloth.

original: dge 'dun ma yin pas rkang pa bris pa'i khri'u bdag gir bya ba bstan par mi bya'o zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: dge 'dun ma yin pas rkang pa bris pa'i khri'u bdag gir bya ba bstan par mi bya'o zhes bya ba ni /
translated: A footstool with painted feet should not be made one‚Äôs own by a non-sa·πÉgha.

analyzed: dge 'dun ma yin pa gang zag gis rkang pa ri mo bris pa'i khri'u bcang bar mi bya'o //
translated: A footstool with painted feet should not be possessed by a non-sa·πÉgha, an individual.

original: 'dir gzhung ni /
analyzed: 'dir gzhung ni /
translated: Here is the text:

analyzed: dge slong gzhan dag khri'u rkang pa khra bo rang gis byed du mi 'jud la /

analyzed: gzhan dag las thob pa ni 'chang bar byed pa dang / bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: But they possess those obtained from others. The Blessed One said:

analyzed: de lta bas na dge 'dun la ni khri'u rkang pa khra bo thob pa dang byed du bcug pa rjes su gnang ngo //
translated: Therefore, for the sa·πÉgha, the possession and making of footstools with variegated legs is permitted.

analyzed: gang zag la ni rnam pa thams cad rjes su mi gnang ngo zhes gsungs pa yin no //

original: stan bzang po dang rgyab rten dang bcas pa'i rten yang mi @372a * //
analyzed: stan bzang po dang rgyab rten dang bcas pa'i rten yang mi @372a * //

original: bya'o ; / zhes bya ba yang dge 'dun ma yin pas bdag gir bya ba bsten par mi bya'o //
analyzed: bya'o ; / zhes bya ba yang dge 'dun ma yin pas bdag gir bya ba bsten par mi bya'o //
translated: This means that the Sa·πÖgha should not make use of what belongs to an individual.

analyzed: stan bzang po zhes bya ba ni stan tshad chen po'o //

analyzed: rgyab rten dang bcas pa'i stan zhes bya ba ni /

analyzed: lus kyi rgyab rten dang bcas pa'i stan no //

original: mar me'i sdang bu yang mi bya'o zhes bya ba ni shing ljon pa'i rnam pa 'dra ba'i mar me'i sdong bu yang dge 'dun ma yin pas bdag gir bya ba bsten par mi bya'o //
analyzed: mar me'i sdang bu yang mi bya'o zhes bya ba ni shing ljon pa'i rnam pa 'dra ba'i mar me'i sdong bu yang dge 'dun ma yin pas bdag gir bya ba bsten par mi bya'o //
translated: One should not make a lamp post. This means that the Sa·πÖgha should not make use of what belongs to an individual, such as a lamp post shaped like a tree.

original: 'dir gzhung ni dge 'dun la ni yal ga gcig pa'i mar me'i sdong bu rnyed na yang rjes su gnang ngo //
analyzed: 'dir gzhung ni dge 'dun la ni yal ga gcig pa'i mar me'i sdong bu rnyed na yang rjes su gnang ngo //
translated: Here the text says, ‚ÄúIf the Sa·πÖgha obtains a lamp post with one branch, it is permitted.

original: gang zag la ni rjes su mi gnang ngo //
analyzed: gang zag la ni rjes su mi gnang ngo //
translated: But it is not permitted for an individual.‚Äù

original: yal ga gnyis pa dang mang po yang de bzhin no zhes gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: yal ga gnyis pa dang mang po yang de bzhin no zhes gsungs pa yin no //

analyzed: kha cig las ni yal ga du ma pa zhes so zhes bya ba ni /

analyzed: lugs kha cig las ni yal ga du ma dang ldan pa'i mar me'i sdong bu dge 'dun ma yin pas bdag gir bya ba bsten par mi bya'o //
translated: In some traditions, it is said that one should not use a lamp post with many branches that belongs to the sa·πÖgha.

original: yal ga kha cig dang ldan pa bdag gir byas pa la ni nyes pa med do zhes 'byung ngo //
analyzed: yal ga kha cig dang ldan pa bdag gir byas pa la ni nyes pa med do zhes 'byung ngo //
translated: There is no fault in using one with a few branches that belongs to an individual.

original: stan nang tshangs can gru bzhi dang sngas nang tshangs can bcang bar bya'o zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: stan nang tshangs can gru bzhi dang sngas nang tshangs can bcang bar bya'o zhes bya ba ni /
translated: One should use a square cushion with cotton stuffing and a pillow with cotton stuffing.

original: dge 'dun dang gang zag gis kyang ngo //
analyzed: dge 'dun dang gang zag gis kyang ngo //
translated: This applies to the sa·πÖgha and individuals.

original: stan nang tshangs can zhes bya ba ni shing bal can no //
analyzed: stan nang tshangs can zhes bya ba ni shing bal can no //
translated: A cushion with cotton stuffing means one with cotton.

original: sngas nang nang tshangs can gyi rnam pa bstan pa'i phyir khru bzhi dang do pa nyis bltab tu byas te /
analyzed: sngas nang nang tshangs can gyi rnam pa bstan pa'i phyir khru bzhi dang do pa nyis bltab tu byas te /
translated: In order to show the form of a pillow with cotton stuffing, it says, ‚Äúfour cubits long and two cubits wide, folded in half.‚Äù

original: bcom mo zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: bcom mo zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: It is cut.

original: srid du ni khru bzhi pa nyis bltab zheng du ni khru do pa nyid bltab tu byas te btsem mo //üîΩshing bal gyis brdzang ngo zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: srid du ni khru bzhi pa nyis bltab zheng du ni khru do pa nyid bltab tu byas te btsem mo // shing bal gyis brdzang ngo zhes bya ba ni /
translated: It is four cubits long and two cubits wide, and it is sewn together with a double thickness.üîΩIt is stuffed with cotton wool.

original: stan nang tshangs can dang sngas nang tshangs can dag go //
analyzed: stan nang tshangs can dang sngas nang tshangs can dag go //
translated: This refers to a mattress and a pillow that are stuffed with cotton wool.

original: so sor brtag par ma byas par nyal bar mi bya'o zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: so sor brtag par ma byas par nyal bar mi bya'o zhes bya ba ni /
translated: One should not lie down without having examined the bed and seat.

original: mal dang stan la so sor brtag par ma byas par der nyal bar mi bya'o //
analyzed: mal dang stan la so sor brtag par ma byas par der nyal bar mi bya'o //
translated: One should not lie down on a bed or seat without having examined it.

original: 'dir gzhung ni /
analyzed: 'dir gzhung ni /
translated: Here is the text:

original: nyal bar byed na so sor brtags te nyal bar bya'o zhes gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: nyal bar byed na so sor brtags te nyal bar bya'o zhes gsungs pa yin no //
translated: If one is going to lie down, one should lie down after having examined.

original: dran pa nye bar ma bzhag par mi bya'o zhes bya ba ni nyal bar mi bya ba ste /
analyzed: dran pa nye bar ma bzhag par mi bya'o zhes bya ba ni nyal bar mi bya ba ste /
translated: One should not lie down without having established mindfulness.

original: 'dir dran pa zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: 'dir dran pa zhes bya ba ni /
translated: Here, mindfulness is

original: dge ba brtsams pa dang / 'brel ba dang / dge ba'i phyogs gzhan dang 'brel ba dag dus ji lta ba bzhin du ldang ba dang / 'brel pa dang / lus dang gos mi 'phyar ba dang 'brel ba'i dran pa @372b yin par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: dge ba brtsams pa dang / 'brel ba dang / dge ba'i phyogs gzhan dang 'brel ba dag dus ji lta ba bzhin du ldang ba dang / 'brel pa dang / lus dang gos mi 'phyar ba dang 'brel ba'i dran pa @372b yin par rig par bya'o //
translated: It should be understood that mindfulness is the timely rising, the timely meeting, and the timely association with those who have begun to practice virtue, with those who are related, and with those who are on the side of virtue.

original: gzhan dang lhan gcig khri'am stan nam gzhan la cig car mi bya'o zhes bya ba ni nyal bar mi bya ba ste /
analyzed: gzhan dang lhan gcig khri'am stan nam gzhan la cig car mi bya'o zhes bya ba ni nyal bar mi bya ba ste /
translated: One should not lie down on a bed or seat together with another person.

original: gzhan zhes smos pa ni stegs bu la sogs pa dag bsdu'o //
analyzed: gzhan zhes smos pa ni stegs bu la sogs pa dag bsdu'o //
translated: The word ‚Äúanother‚Äù includes platforms, etc.

original: ngo tsha shes pas med na stan so sor bting ste gtur bu'am lhung bzed kyi snod la sogs pas bar du bcad nas dran pa nye bar gzhag ste nyal bar bya'o zhes bya ba ni /

translated: If there is no other bed, one should lie down on separate beds covered with mats, separated by a cloth, a wooden panel, or a piece of leather, and one should lie down mindfully.

analyzed: dge slong ngo tsha shes shing khrel yod pas ni khri la sogs pa mal tha dad pa med pa na /
translated: If there is no separate bed, etc., a monk who is ashamed and embarrassed should lie down on the same bed, etc.,

analyzed: gding ba'i stan so sor bting ste chos gos kyi gtur bu'am lhung bzed kyi snod la sogs pas bar du bcad nas dran pa nye bar gzhag ste khri'am stan nam gzhan de'i steng du gzhan dang lhan cig nyal bar bya'o //
translated: Having spread out the sitting mat on the ground, one should lie down on the bed, the seat, or another surface, with mindfulness established, having placed something between oneself and the wall, such as a Dharma robe or a begging bowl.

original: 'di ni phan tshul lus reg pa spang ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'di ni phan tshul lus reg pa spang ba'i phyir ro //
translated: This is in order to avoid the possibility of physical contact with another person.

original: gsum las lhag pa mang ba dang lhan cig khri las 'dzeg pa nyid bsten par mi bya'o zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: gsum las lhag pa mang ba dang lhan cig khri las 'dzeg pa nyid bsten par mi bya'o zhes bya ba ni /
translated: One should not ascend a bed together with more than three people.

original: gang zag gsum las lhag pa mang po dang lhan cig tu khri gcig gi steng du 'dzegs pa dang 'dug pa dang nyal bar mi bya'o //
analyzed: gang zag gsum las lhag pa mang po dang lhan cig tu khri gcig gi steng du 'dzegs pa dang 'dug pa dang nyal bar mi bya'o //
translated: One should not ascend, sit, or lie down on a bed together with more than three people.

original: 'di skad bstan te /
analyzed: 'di skad bstan te /
translated: This is what is being taught.

original: khri gcig gi steng du gang zag gnyis sam gsum ni 'dzeg pa dang 'dug pa dang nyal bar bya'i /
analyzed: khri gcig gi steng du gang zag gnyis sam gsum ni 'dzeg pa dang 'dug pa dang nyal bar bya'i /
translated: Two or three people may ascend, sit, or lie down on the same bed.

original: bzhi yan chad ni mi bya'o //
analyzed: bzhi yan chad ni mi bya'o //
translated: But four or more people should not do so.

original: khri ring po la ni gnyis las mi bya'o zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: khri ring po la ni gnyis las mi bya'o zhes bya ba ni /
translated: Two people should not do so on a long bed.

original: lhag par mang po dang lhan cig 'dzeg pa nyid bsten par mi bya ba'o //
analyzed: lhag par mang po dang lhan cig 'dzeg pa nyid bsten par mi bya ba'o //
translated: In particular, one should not sit on a seat together with many people.

original: khri'u la gcig ma yin pas mi bya'o zhes bya ba ni gcig po kho na de la 'dug par bya'o //
analyzed: khri'u la gcig ma yin pas mi bya'o zhes bya ba ni gcig po kho na de la 'dug par bya'o //
translated: ‚ÄúOne should not sit on a bench with someone who is not a monk‚Äù means that one should sit on a bench only with a monk.

original: de ni khri thung du'i dpe yin par blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: de ni khri thung du'i dpe yin par blta bar bya'o //
translated: This is an example of a short bench.

original: shing gi spang leb la ni stobs ci yod pa dang go ci yod pa las shes par bya'o //üîΩlo gsum las lhag pas bar du chod pa dang lhan cig stan la 'dug par mi bya'o zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: shing gi spang leb la ni stobs ci yod pa dang go ci yod pa las shes par bya'o // lo gsum las lhag pas bar du chod pa dang lhan cig stan la 'dug par mi bya'o zhes bya ba ni /
translated: One should understand the length of a long bench according to the strength and ability of the person.

original: dge slong rdzogs par bsnyen pa'i dus lo gsum las lhag pas bar du chod cing khyad zhugs pa rgan pa dang lhan cig stan gcig la 'dug par mi bya ste /
analyzed: dge slong rdzogs par bsnyen pa'i dus lo gsum las lhag pas bar du chod cing khyad zhugs pa rgan pa dang lhan cig stan gcig la 'dug par mi bya ste /
translated: ‚ÄúOne should not sit on a seat together with someone who is more than three years senior‚Äù means that one should not sit on the same seat with someone who is more than three years senior and who is a fully ordained monk.

original: 'di ltar gzhon pa ches rgan pa dang lhan cig tu 'dug par mi rigs pa'i phyir ro //

analyzed: mchod par rung ba'i rdzas gang yin pa de dag ni dus ston gyi mchod pa bya ba'i phyir gzhag par bya'o zhes gsungs pa yin no //

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /

original: yang na 'bob la sogs pa'i gos kyis dkris te ston pa'i 'du shes mngon du byas nas dgos pa'i don gyi brnab sems kyi dran pa dag gis dge tshul dag mchod rten la 'dzeg tu gzhug go //

translated: If they do not wash their feet with scented water, then for that reason they should rub their feet with scented oil, or wrap them in cloth such as a blanket, and then, with the perception of the Teacher present, with the recollection of the covetousness of the purpose, they should make the novices ascend the stupa.
